text.p: Coastal Physician Group Inc said chief financial officer and director Stephen Corman has resigned in conjunction with a settlement of claims made in a lawsuit against the company, Corman, and others by two Coastal Physician directors.

The settlement, which dismisses all claims against Corman, was approved by Coastal's board Wednesday and further calls for Corman to provide financial consulting services to Coastal over a five-month period.
For the last few months, Coastal has been involved in a proxy battle with former chief executive Steven Scott for control of the company's board.
Pending court approval, the settlement will be a full resolution of all claims in the lawsuit against Corman.
Coastal named Timothy Trost to serve as chief financial officer following Corman's resignation.
Trost joined Coastal as vice president of corporate development in March 1994 and was named vice president, corporate controller and chief accounting officer in January 1996.
